samples.context: The human brain can be divided into three regions, viz. forebrain, midbrain and hindbrain.
samples.question: What are the three regions of the human brain?

samples.context: Forebrain: It is composed of the cerebrum.
samples.question: What is the main structure of the forebrain?

samples.context: Midbrain: It is composed of the hypothalamus.
samples.question: Which structure composes the midbrain?

samples.context: Hindbrain: It is composed of the cerebellum, pons and medulla oblongata.
samples.question: What structures make up the hindbrain?

samples.context: The human brain can be divided into three regions, viz. forebrain, midbrain and hindbrain.
samples.question: Name one of the three regions of the brain.

samples.context: Hindbrain: It is composed of the cerebellum, pons and medulla oblongata.
samples.question: Which brain region includes the cerebellum?
